metadata.dc:author: Prieto Sánchez, Elisa
González-Pérez, José M
Guerrero-Palma, Miguel A
Fernández-Pérez, Antonio
Avila-Espín, Luis
Moreno-León, Javier A
metadata.dc:description: Three cases of rare entities in nasal pathology are reported. Two of them are high-grade lymphomas (T/NK type), with nasal blockage as the first symptom. Clinical course and treatment response are described. The third case refers to an infrequent benign nasal entity called angiocentric eosinophilic fibrosis. Its aetiology and management remains rather uncertain nowadays.
metadata.dc:title: Entidades clínicas nasales inusuales.
[Unusual nasal clinical entities].
